alert.note: Alert for Bay; Midland; Saginaw (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 17 at 5:32PM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...AREAS OF HEAVY SNOW AFFECTING THE TRI CITIES DURING THE EVENING COMMUTE... HAZARDS...An area of heavy snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to near a quarter of a mile. Temperatures at or below freezing also allow roads to become snow covered with a quick inch of accumulation on unpaved surfaces. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 530 PM EST, areas of heavy snow were along and west of a line from Sanford to near St. Charles to 6 miles north of St. Johns and moving east at 35 MPH. THIS AREA OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Bridgeport around 550 PM EST. Saginaw and Zilwaukee around 555 PM EST. Oakley around 600 PM EST. Frankenmuth, Chesaning, Kawkawlin, Linwood and Munger around 605 PM EST. Pinconning around 610 PM EST. Birch Run around 635 PM EST. This includes the following highways... I-75 between mile markers 134 and 185. I-675 between mile markers 1 and 7. US-10 between mile markers 102 and 139. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution when traveling into or through areas of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
